newsitem.title: TANZANIA: Rinderpest hits Tanzania's northern region.
newsitem.headline: Rinderpest hits Tanzania's northern region.

text.p: Rinderpest, a highly infectious cattle disease, is threatening livestock and wildlife in northern Tanzania, the official Shihata news agency said on Sunday.
Shihata quoted a senior agriculture ministry official as saying Tanzania needed $3 million to fight the epidemic which has already swept across large areas of East Africa.

A campaign to vaccinate cattle in northern Tanzania was launched in January but is likely to require additional funding, the official said. The European Union (EU) has contributed $300,000 towards the cost of vaccines and transport.
